resources.string: CPU Time is the time spent processing a given job, discounting I/O time and other jobsâ€™ shares. It is comprised of user CPU time and system CPU time. Different programs are affected differently by CPU and system performance.\n
CPU Time = CPU Clock Cycles * Clock Cycle Time
CPU Time = CPU Clock Cycles / Clock Rate
CPU Time = Instruction Count * CPI * Clock Cycle Time
CPU Time = (Instruction Count * CPI) / Clock Rate
CPU Clock Cycles: The number of clock cycles a particular job will take to complete.
Clock Cycle Time: The amount of time, in seconds, that it takes for one clock cycle to complete (i.e. from an edge to edge, rising or falling).
Clock Rate: The number of clock cycles that complete (i.e. from edge to edge, rising or falling) within one second.
CPI: The number of cycles it takes to complete one instruction.
Instruction Count: The number of instructions within a particular job.
